intro: Hieracium porrifolium, commonly known as the turnip-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the upper leaves are more elongated and lobed. Its flowers are typically yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium porrifolium is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in disturbed soils.
